quest.name: Finding Good Help
journal: Chai-Nuzz's look of steely determination is only slightly undermined by the knocking of his knees.

Rather than build Talos from scratch, Chai-Nuzz proposes capturing the long-abandoned Talos which wander the wilds of Kholusia. A singularly dangerous endeavor, but one which holds no terror for him, knowing as he does that the perfect tools for the task are waiting for you at Top Rung.

The reason for Chai-Nuzz's uncharacteristic self-confidence soon becomes apparent when he shows you a crate filled with canisters whose contents can incapacitate Talos. Moreover, they can be thrown from a distance, making the task surprisingly risk-free. So risk-free, in fact, that Chai-Nuzz volunteers to do the deed himself. He still requires support, however, lest he run afoul of the local wildlife. To that end, you set out for the Quick Way in search of a vantage point from which to warn him of danger.

With heart in throat and canisters in hand, Chai-Nuzz braves the wilds of Kholusia, succeeding at length in subduing a trio of Talos. As the last of them succumbs, you see him pause, seemingly awestruck by the scale of his own achievement. Or perhaps injured. You rush down to be certain.

Your concerns vanish as you near a visibly elated Chai-Nuzz, now the proud owner of three Talos which he is eager to dispatch to Eulmore. After a few adjustments, they spring back to life, and he sends them marching off in the direction of the city.

At the end of a tiring trek through Kholusia, you arrive in Gatetown to find the Talos have attracted a crowd. Among them, you spy Lady Chai, who is near speechless at the sight of her husband. She duly rushes over to him, wasting no time in showing him the strength of her affection. A strength which renders him briefly unconscious.

Doubts finally assuaged, Wrenden expresses his admiration for Chai-Nuzz and the devotion of those close to him. Taking note of the chattering throng which has formed around the Talos, he declares that it will soon be time for the intrepid entrepreneur to address his fellow citizens as mayor.
objectives: Guide Chai-Nuzz from the vantage point.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: That Wrenden geezer doesn't seem so bad. What was Master Chai worried about? He's got to give himself a bit more credit!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do you see it? There is a fire in Master Chai's eyes that was not there when first we met. A fire we had best keep kindled if we wish to see Eulmore change for the better.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: You had a hand in constructing that giant Talos to the north, did you not?

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: When the Eulmoran volunteers began arriving, I hid myself away, lest I be recognized...thus depriving myself of what I am reliably informed was a once-in-a-lifetime spectacle. Bugger.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Wrenden is quite right. Building Talos from scratch would require time we simply do not have.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Which is why I propose to make use of the long-abandoned Talos which wander the wilds of Kholusia.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: They will need to be deactivated, of course, and if memory serves, the tools required to do so should still be at Top Rung. Come with me.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: How'd you catch a Talos, then? Dig a hole and lure it in?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is one thing to repair an immobile Talos, as Urianger did, but quite another to catch one, surely? Does this not sound a trifle dangerous?

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: So he is an authority on Talos, is he? Hmph! What other surprises could he be hiding, I wonder...

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Aha! The old memory hasn't let me down!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: This chest contains canisters filled with a dashedly potent insulating powder capable of halting the flow of aether in a Talos. We need only get within throwing distance of one and let fly.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Thus disabling them without damaging them! Ingenious!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: An old trick of the trade, nothing more. Once disabled, it should be a simple enough matter to get them to march to Eulmore. More extensive repairs can wait.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Ordinarily, this is where I would ask you to run along and do the deed, but as I have said before, it's high time we learned to stand on our own two feet.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Thankfully, throwing canisters is something even I should be able to manage.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Come off it, Master Chai!

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Even if the Talos ain't a threat, there's a hundred and one other things out there waiting to make a meal of you!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: That's as may be, Kai-Shirr, but Wrenden tasked me with solving this problem, and I will not sit idly by while others risk everything to see my harebrained schemes realized. Not this time!

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: ...Which isn't to say the mere thought of it doesn't fill me with dread. Truth be told, I can't feel my legs.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: But if I'm to prove I'm a man worth following, I must lead by example.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well said, Master Chai!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Hear, hear!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: All right, but if there's any trouble, we call it off.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Yes, well, it should go without saying that I have no intention of dying for this. I've always preferred living to see the fruits of my labors.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: And to make sure I do, I will require your help. It is as Kai-Shirr says─these lands are dangerous if one is not careful. I would ask you to use my spyglass to look out for any beasts that could get in the way of my work. I will also need you to alert me when it is safe to subdue the Talos. Understood?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Good. Then let's be off to the Quick Way, through the north gate, and see if we can't find a suitable vantage point for you.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Either Master Chai's off his nut, or this means more to him than he's been letting on.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There is little point in us both shouting instructions. Keep him safe, Forename.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: When first he arrived, I could barely hear him over the knocking of his knees. And now this. I'm not sure what's gotten into him, but whatever it is, I like it.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: All right. Nothing to worry about. Just a simple matter of sneaking up on the Talos while avoiding the slavering, bloodthirsty beasts lurking behind every rock. Child's play... Ahem. When you're ready, let us begin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Keep a lookout for danger and alert Chai-Nuzz when it is safe to incapacitate the Talos. You may move the spyglass, as well as zoom in and out. Point the spyglass at Chai-Nuzz and give him the signal to sneak near the Talos with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I...I did it? I did it! Let's move on to another Talos, shall we?

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I do believe I'm getting the hang of this.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: You may leave the next one to me, Forename.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Haha! That should do it! Now we have all we need to proceed.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Blimey... Thought my heart was going to stop for a moment there. Make that a couple of moments.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our friend returned with nary a scratch. Well done.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: It would seem I misjudged Master Chai. There may yet be hope for Eulmore.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I can scarcely believe it. It was a reckless, foolish plan. But somehow...it worked.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I...I did it.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Master Chai. I believe I owe you an apology.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Your plan to replenish Eulmore's food stores showed forethought and sound judgment. What's more, it is plain your time at Daedalus Stoneworks has equipped you to lead, as evidenced by the extraordinary company you keep.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: You, sir, are more than qualified to be the next mayor of Eulmore.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I thank you for your vote of confidence, but the fact remains, I am wholly ignorant of the world of politics.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Which is why I would ask you to join me, and grant Eulmore the benefit of your counsel.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: I would be honored.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: When the people behold these Talos, I have no doubt they will lend you their support.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It would seem Eulmore's leadership is at last in capable hands, would you not agree?

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: We should probably be getting back soon, Master Chai. After you've tinkered with the Talos and all that. Lady Chai's worried sick.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Sorry I wasn't much help. Still, seeing Master Chai go after those Talos was something, eh? Inspiring stuff.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I daresay the future of Eulmore has never looked brighter.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: <cough> <cough> I...I'm fine... I just need...a moment... <wheeze>

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Thank you again for finding my husband. I confess, I was not expecting your return to be quite so grand!

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: That dear, sweet man. He is going to make the most wonderful mayor. I just know it!

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: That was quite a reception. One Master Chai will struggle to forget.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: More seriously, the arrival of the Talos has seized the public's attention.

dialogue.name: WRENDEN
dialogue.text: Once word has spread around Eulmore, it will be that much simpler to gather one and all so that Master Chai can make his inaugural address.
